t.x: Pleasing. Excellent. Comfortable.
e: This is good / nice.
It's really good / nice.
Being good / nice is a positive/negative characteristic.
Understanding the nuance of good / nice enables subtle emotional expression.

t.x: Not good. Harmful. Wrong.
e: This is bad.
It's really bad.
Being bad is a positive/negative characteristic.
Understanding the nuance of bad enables subtle emotional expression.

t.x: Size is above average. Sound is high.
e: This is big / large / loud.
It's really big / large / loud.
Being big / large / loud is a positive/negative characteristic.
Understanding the nuance of big / large / loud enables subtle emotional expression.

t.x: Size is below average.
e: This is small / little.
It's really small / little.
Being small / little is a positive/negative characteristic.
Understanding the nuance of small / little enables subtle emotional expression.

t.x: Quantity or degree is large.
e: This is many / much / a lot.
It's really many / much / a lot.

Understanding the nuance of many / much / a lot enables subtle emotional expression.

t.x: Quantity or degree is small.

t.x: The distance from one end to the other is close.

t.x: The taste of food is good.
e: This is really delicious!
My mother's cooking is the most delicious.
"Masitda" can express not just taste but also great experiences.
In Korean, "delicious" goes beyond taste to express satisfaction and admiration.
